Bash(git commit -m "$\(cat <<''EOF''
Add granular permission management system with 41 permissions across 10 categories

Implemented a comprehensive permission management system that allows administrators
to grant/revoke individual permissions to users beyond their role defaults.

Backend Changes:
- Created 3 new models: PermissionCategory, Permission, UserPermission
- Added User model methods: has_permission\(\), get_effective_permissions\(\)
- Created 5 API endpoints for user/permission management
- Added permission seeder with 41 permissions across 10 categories:
  * Program Management \(4 permissions\)
  * Subject Management \(4 permissions\)
  * Schedule Management \(4 permissions\)
  * Enrollment Management \(4 permissions\)
  * Grade Management \(5 permissions\)
  * Payment Management \(4 permissions\)
  * Document Management \(4 permissions\)
  * Audit & Logs \(3 permissions\)
  * User Management \(6 permissions\)
  * System Configuration \(3 permissions\)
- Fixed SQLite compatibility for JSONField queries
- All permission changes logged to audit trail

Frontend Changes:
- Created admin user management page \(/admin-users.html\)
- Added search & filter by role functionality
- Implemented toggle-based permission UI grouped by category
- Added permission status indicators \(role default, custom grant, custom revoke\)
- Real-time permission updates with toast notifications
- Updated admin navigation to include User Management link

Migration:
- accounts/0006_add_permission_system.py

Management Command:
- python manage.py seed_permissions \(seeds 41 permissions\)

Bash(git commit -m "$\(cat <<''EOF''
Enable subjects to belong to multiple programs with checkbox-only UI

Implemented multi-program subject assignment allowing subjects to be shared
across different programs \(e.g., ENG101 in BSIT, BSIS, BSCS\).

Backend Changes:
- Added ''programs'' ManyToMany field to Subject model \(backward compatible\)
- Changed unique constraint from \(program, code\) to globally unique code
- Updated Subject save\(\) to auto-include primary program in programs list
- Added program_codes field to SubjectSerializer
- Updated prerequisite validation to check all programs
- Updated section and curriculum validation for multi-program support
- Fixed filtering to use programs field with distinct\(\)

Frontend Changes:
- Replaced primary program dropdown with checkbox-only interface
- First checked program automatically becomes primary program
- Updated Add Subject modal to show all programs as checkboxes
- Updated Edit Subject modal to pre-check programs
- Display shows all program codes \(comma-separated\) for multi-program subjects
- Form handlers collect all checked programs

Database Migration:
- academics/0009_add_subject_programs.py
- Populates programs field with existing primary program for all subjects

Key Features:
- Backward compatible \(keeps existing ''program'' ForeignKey\)
- Subject codes globally unique
- Prerequisites must exist in ALL subject''s programs
- Validation ensures at least one program selected

Bash(git commit -m "$\(cat <<''EOF''
Add comprehensive data seeders with proper prerequisite ordering

Created two management commands for seeding realistic test data:

1. seed_subjects_with_prereqs.py \(Completed & Tested\):
   - Seeds 42 subjects across 4 programs \(BSIT, BSIS, BSCS, BSBA\)
   - Creates 31 prerequisite relationships with proper ordering
   - CRITICAL: Ensures NO subject has prerequisites from same year/semester
   - Multi-program support \(subjects can belong to multiple programs\)
   - Automatic validation checks prerequisite ordering
   - Year 1 Sem 1: 8 foundation subjects \(no prereqs\)
   - Year 1 Sem 2: 8 subjects \(prereqs from Y1S1 only\)
   - Year 2 Sem 1: 6 subjects \(prereqs from Y1 only\)
   - Year 2 Sem 2: 5 subjects \(prereqs from Y2S1 and earlier\)
   - Year 3-4: Continues proper ordering through graduation

2. seed_complete_data.py \(Framework - Needs Model Updates\):
   - Comprehensive seeder structure for all 29 models
   - 9-layer dependency hierarchy implementation
   - 50 users across all roles \(admins, registrars, professors, students\)
   - 22 students distributed across programs and year levels
   - Sections, schedules, enrollments, grades, payments, permits
   - Note: Requires model name corrections to match actual DB structure

Prerequisites Validation:
âœ… All prerequisites are from EARLIER year/semester
âœ… No circular dependencies
âœ… Proper academic progression \(Y1â†’Y2â†’Y3â†’Y4\)

Usage:
  python manage.py seed_subjects_with_prereqs
